page.title: 07BRAYTON TOLL HOUSE
page.content: The{toll house}has a lot of history behind it. It has 5 rooms and 2 aviaries. It was built in{1771.}The {toll collecting room}was built half hexagonal in shape so the collector could see up and down the road. Mr. Prescott Barr is the present owner. He has newspaper cuttings of the{toll {house.}One is about a car that smashed through the toll collecting room. It did not take long to repair. The kitchen used to be a bathroom which is now moved into the back room. The walls are made of stucco which he showed us when we went out of the door. The birds he has are from all over the world - Australia, America etc. It is reputed that{Dick Turpin jumped over the toll gate on{Black {Bess}to avoid paying his toll to York. {James Melody & Gary Sullivan
